intro: Syzygium oahuense, commonly known as the Oahu hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, while its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Syzygium oahuense is considered a rare and endangered species, threatened by habitat loss and invasive species.
